hero.title: Earn Your Commercial Pilot Certificate
hero.subtitle: Start your pilot career with your commercial pilot certificate

intro.title: Become a Commercial Pilot
intro.description: A commercial pilot certificate allows you to fly for compensation or hire.

definition.title: What is a Commercial Pilot Certificate?
content: A Commercial Pilot Certificate allows you to fly for compensation or hire, opening doors to various aviation careers such as flight instructing, surveying, skydiving operations, and more. At Blue Skies Above, we provide structured training programs that prepare you for these opportunities.
When you start commercial pilot training, you'll deepen your understanding of aviation regulations, including the requirements for different parts of the FAR, and learn to fly with greater precision.
Although not mandatory, completing your Instrument Rating alongside your Commercial Pilot Certificate expands the types of flying you can do for compensation, such as under Part 135 operations.

prerequisites.title: Complete Your Instrument Rating
prerequisites.description: While not technically a requirement, not having an instrument rating when completing you commercial pilot certificate limits you in the type of flying you can do for compensation.

prerequisites.title: Log Flight Hours
prerequisites.description: You need 250 total flight hours to get your commercial pilot certificate. 110 of these hours are normally logged when getting your PPL and IR, but the other 140 will be logged via time building.

prerequisites.title: Meet Minimum Requirements
prerequisites.description: Once you're approaching 250 total flight hours, there are different types of cross-country trips that you are required to complete to meet the minimum requirements to take the commercial pilot practical exam.

prerequisites.title: Fly With an Examiner
prerequisites.description: You'll fly with an FAA Designated Pilot Examiner (DPE) and demonstrate you have the skills to fly as a commercial pilot in a TAA aircraft and meet the requirements of the Airmen Certification Standards (ACS).

video.title: Can you use a TAA aircraft for commercial pilot requirements?
video.description: Discover how our new Cessna 172N model, equipped as a Technically Advanced Aircraft (TAA), can help you efficiently build flight hours while meeting the necessary requirements for your commercial pilot certificate.

trainingExpectations.title: What to Expect During Training
trainingExpectations.description: Prepare to fly at a higher standard, where precision is key. The ACS standards for commercial pilots are stricter compared to private pilots, ensuring you develop the skills needed to fly professionally.

pricing.title: Learn More About Our Training Packages
pricing.description: Choose the best package that fits your aviation goals.

packages.name: Commercial Pilot Certificate With Time Building
packages.description: Make flying your career with Commercial Pilot Certificate

packages.name: Finish-Up or Added Rating
packages.description: Complete or obtain additional qualifications. Make flying your career.

careerPaths.title: What Careers are Available to Commercial Pilots?
careerPaths.description: Once you complete your commercial pilot training, various aviation roles become accessible, allowing you to build flight time and gain experience while getting paid to fly.

paths.title: Certified Flight Instructor (CFI)
paths.description: Teach aspiring pilots, enhance your skills, and build flight hours.

paths.title: Survey Pilot
paths.description: Conduct aerial surveys for mapping, environmental monitoring, or infrastructure assessments.

paths.title: Skydive Pilot
paths.description: Provide smooth and safe ascents for skydivers, contributing to their thrilling experiences.

paths.title: Charter Pilot
paths.description: Offer personalized flight services, transporting business executives, leisure travelers, or cargo.

paths.title: Agricultural Pilot
paths.description: Apply fertilizers and insecticides on crops, flying close to the ground.

paths.title: Missionary Pilot
paths.description: Serve remote communities by transporting humanitarian aid, medical supplies, or personnel.

paths.title: Airline Pilot
paths.description: Pilots with their ATP and 1500 hours can join the airlines and fly for regional, major, and legacy carriers.

callToAction.title: We are the flight training experts in Lanett, AL
callToAction.subtitle: Providing pilot training to the Auburn, Columbus, Opelika, LaGrange, Montgomery areas in Alabama and Georgia
callToAction.description: As the only independent flight school with a Cessna fleet in the area, we pride ourselves in training safe and highly proficient pilots. Come see what everyone's talking about! Visit Blue Skies Above and begin flight training today.

nextSteps.title: Next Steps Visit Blue Skies Above Professional Flight Instruction
nextSteps.description: Visit our flight school, start pilot training and join the family, like & follow us on social media. We're excited to partner with you and be a part of your aviation journey. Let's go flying together!
